citation.article-title: Sphingosinicella microcystinivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a microcystin-degrading bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Sphingosinicella (Sphin.go.si′ni.cel′la. N.L. n. sphingosinum sphingosine; L. fem. n. cella a store-room and in biology a cell; N.L. fem. n. Sphingosinicella sphingosine-containing cell).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming rods, motile by means of polar flagella.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
The major fatty acids are 18 : 1ω7c and 16 : 1ω7c.
2-Hydroxy fatty acids are present, with 2-OH 14 : 0 predominating.
Homospermidine is the major polyamine component, as for the genus Sphingomonas.
Placed phylogenetically in the family Sphingomonadaceae.
The characteristic 16S rRNA signatures are the same as for the genus Sphingomonas: 52 : 359 (C : G), 134 (G), 593 (G), 987 : 1218 (G : C) and 990 : 1215 (U : G).
The type species is Sphingosinicella microcystinivorans.
